Description: Bluish-green mould-blown conical glass beaker with a slightly inturned, cut and ground rim and a flat base. Decorated in high relief with figured decoration: perhaps Hercules with a calf; Mercury with a staff; Summer; Winter or Spring.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.96)
Harden et al 1968 / Masterpieces of Glass (64)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007 18 Oct-2008 14 Jan, USA, Malibu, J. Paul Getty Museum at the Getty Villa, Reflecting Antiquity: Modern Glass Inspired by Ancient Rome 2008 15 Feb-27 May, USA, Corning, Corning Museum of Glass, Reflecting Antiquity: Modern Glass Inspired by Ancient Rome
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Austen Henry Layard
